ngoList.address: BALA VISHWANATH 125, Nalanda Convent Road Raghavendra Nagar Tumkur-572102
ngoList.title: NILALAYA NRITYA KENDRA
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bala Vishwanath Kethar is a Bharatanatya Dancer and Choreographer. She was initiated into the classical art, at a very tender age, by Guru Smt. Rajeswari Sainath, of Hyderabad. She has also undergone special training in Jathi and Laya, under the famous Mridangam Vidwan, Sri. Karaikkudi R Mani Iyer. She potrays Pandanallur style of Bharathanatyam. At present, she is the Director of Nilalaya Nritya Kendra, Tumkur. She has performed in major centres like Madras Music Academy, Mylapore Fine Arts, Puri Beach Festival, Kalidas Samaroh Nagpur, Nada Mandapa, Mysore and foreign centres in Brazil, Nepal etc. The Govt. of Karnataka awarded her with Zilla Rajyotsava Prashasthi. Bala was awarded the Scholarship to Young Artistes in Bharathanatyam Dance by Ministry of Culture, New Delhi in the year 2000-01. She performed the Rangapravesha of her three students Priya Bharadwaj, Mamatha Hebbar and Smitha Rani at Dr. Gubbi Veeranna Kalakshetra, Tumkur in 2003. Bala has choreographed dance ballets Durga Charitham, Gopalam Bhajare, Dasavatharam and Venkateshwara Vaibhavam. Bala performed Vachana Vaibhava, a dance drama based on the vachanas during Centenary Celebrations of Sri Sri Shiva Kumara Swamiji at Siddaganga Mutt, Tumkur in the presence of Her Excellency Smt. Pratibha Patil, President of India in 2009. She also performed Vachanas in Nritya Roopaka during Lakshadeepothsava at Yediyur. She performed a ballet Andal Nrityanjali sponsored by TVS Electronics, at the holy shrine of Sri Devarayana Durga, Tumkur and potrayed Andals divine activities and her union with Lord Ranganananda. Doordarshan Bangalore celebrated their Golden Function Madura Madura Ve Manjula Gaana at Birla Auditorium, S.I.T College, Tumkur in 2009. Bala had an unique opportunity to present Bharathanatyam Dance for three songs. Her dance was well appreciated with a live replay by DD Bangalore Kendra throughout India and abroad. Bala was a Judge for Tha Ka Dhi Mi Tha programme in Jaya TV, a Jury member in Halcyon 2011, Sri Siddaganga Institute of Technology, Tumkur and Chief Guest at Saroj Madhu Kala Utsav, Mangalore in 2011. She performed a fund raising dance, for the building of Sri.Nimishambal Temple, Tumkur. She performed with her students, in Swarna Karnataka Janapada Jatre, Hampi Utsav, Jenkar Utsav, Davengere Utsav, Kudala Sangama Festival, Tourism Festival at Chennai etc. Recently she participated at Devaram festival organized by Narada Gana Sabha and Sri Ramalingar Manram, Chennai. She was fortunate to offer her dance with her disciples at the feet of Lord Nataraja at Natyanjali festival at Chidambaram on 24th Feb 2012. She is equally adept in the art of Nattuvangam. The renowned art critic Subbudu showered praises on her in The Statesman New Delhi. She coaches dance to visually impaired pupils of Sri Siddaganga Mutt, Tumkur. She has a concern for society. She assists Bharathi Stree Samaja, Tumkur in running twelve Creches, for poor children, from backward areas. She is a cultural ambassador, with a social outlook.

Niranthara has organised theatre productions, theatre camps and workshops, theatre documentation and many other meaningful theatre activites in and around Mysore and Karnataka. Theatre is the only media which can influence the people greatly. Keeping this in mind, knowing the capacity and strength of theatre as a media we are emphasising to expand human values through theatre. From several years we are working hard to realise our dreams of building a moralistic, value based society by taking theatre as a media since from the fifteen years. For many years now, Niranthara foundation has been active on a vanity fronts such as theatre, folk arts, literature and environment with a clear vision and social commitment.Niranthara has organized many cultural, and thought provoking critical seminars. We have taken the advice and guidance of experts and specialists to actively participate in all spheres to provide a constructive permanence to them. We have been working with great concern about water and sanitation. we have aroused awareness in the people through documentary films, workshops, poster-making camps, street plays, publication of books and artistic exhibition stalls. We have organized Karnatakas first ever Jala Jatha successfully about rain-water harvesting in Bagalkote district. Niranthara has produced well known plays like Kusumabale by Devanur Mahadeva, Jalagara and Kalki by Kuvempu, Lankeshs MuttisiKondavanu, Tejaswis Maya Mriga and Shariffa by Manjunatha Belakere, K.G.Mallyas the statue of the Mahatma, TeaHouse by the famous Chinese playwright Lao She directed by shri Chidambara Rao Jambe.A dance and musical drama Kudala Sangama based on the vachanas by Basavanna with music by C. Ashwath has been presented by us. Sixty Shows of this play in and around Karnataka. We have also presented Badal Sircars Bhoma which deals with the problems of the peasants. We have been conducting Sahaja Ranga an annual theatre training camp for college students. Every year we are touring Karnataka with Three Productions called Niranthara Ranga Payana. Every year we are conducting a National Theatre Festival Niranthara Ranga Utsava, which has become a premier thaeatre festival of Karnataka. Presenting theatre as a strong cultural media to build a strong society, Niranthara Foundatin is trying to inculcate theatre as an expreson of Indian culture.

ngoList.title: Nrityaangan
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Nrityaangan is a registered trust based out of Mangaluru, India. The organization aims at propagating the art form in and around coastal Karnataka by organizing workshops, lecture demonstrations & dance festivals that will nurture the next generation of artistes and provide them with performance opportunities. Nrityaangan aims to take the divine art forms to the common man. Today any form of Indian Classical Music or Dance has been patronized by only certain sections of the society, mostly by those who are artistically inclined. Nrityaangan attempts to bring the common man to the auditoriums and appreciate the performers attempt to depict a piece of literature through expressions and dance. In the last few years of its inception Nrityaangan has been organizing Samarpan & Manthana, Two annual dance festivals and also has held workshops, lecture demonstrations in and around the coastal city of Mangaluru by internationally acclaimed artistes and Gurus.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: DEPARTMENT OF WOMEN AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT
sourceOfFunds.purpose: We are running the creche for poor children who are aged from 6months to under 3years. In this year Central social welfare Board hand over this scheme to the State authority i.e.,Department of Women and Child development. So they are providing us the funds for running this creche center. But they did not release the pending amount of 9 months still. We are waiting and we are running the creche center with our own expenses. It is a good program for poor families who are going to do job.

We are running this program since the year1990-1991. The parents leave their children in our center and go for their without any tension. We provide nutritious food and milk for their children. We conduct health checkups for every 3 months and we conduct parents meeting once in every month. We run our center daily from 9am to 4pm. We provide 4times nutritious food. We had also provided playing toys for the children. Our staff look after the children very well as well as the children are happy.

To extend to our creche program we celebrate National festivals in our creche center. The public appreciates us for this program and they support us in all ways. We guide the parents in parents meeting and we ask their suggestions. Our staff,Teacher and helper force us to rise their salary but we cannot. So we request the certain department to rise fund amount to run the center successfully. We had also provide training for Teacher and helper that how to look after the child and how to maintain.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sir, Our Trust has completed three years. just now. In the three years duration we have worked in some fields. The trust organised many awareness programs relating to many governament departments. We have conducted many awareness programs about HIV/AIDS in high schools. We haveconducted many Adolescence health and sensitisation programs for boys and girls. We have given 52 awareness programs in several villages in gauribidanur taluk though street plays about the issue of children who are out of school and disabled. These programs were conducted for Sarvashikshs Abhiyan. And we have produced a video film "SANKRAMANA" about out of school children. Further the trust wishes to work in the same field. Thank you.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Prasiddha Foundations two flagship Festivals that featured almost all the top-notch performers of the Country were Sharad Vaibhava and Eka Aneka. Sharad Vaibhava pioneered a colloquium built around a theme and introduced interfacing and dialoguing between artists of different genres and conducted annually from 1991-2003. Eka Aneka was an all night music /dance Festival that re-introduced to Bangalore the viewing of dance and music recitals all night long to re-inforce that Art promoted peace and harmony and was available for all to savour. This event also took place annually from 1993-2004. Almost 10,000 artistes have performed for Prasiddha Foundation in these Festivals.Delhi International Arts Festival Indias Signature Festival is the longest multi arts, multi venue cultural festival has marked its presence since 2007,growing bigger by each passing year,all set be to be around the corner from December 3rd to 12th of the month this year.

ngoList.title: Pratyusha Public Charitable Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sensitising people on our rich cultural legacy and its traditional art forms through classical dance training, events, performances, lecture-demonstrations, discussions and seminars. Free classical dance classes for underprivileged children belonging to economically weaker sections and many government schools. Helping artistes for a better living by support and training on dance as profession. Hosting annual Odissi dance festival, NAMAN since last 9 years and many more classical dance events.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Nrityantar, a unit of Pratyusha Public Charitable Trust organised its 9th annual Odissi dance festival, NAMAN 2018 on August 12th. NAMAN showcased finest of Odissi dancers from all over. It also presented a 2-day classical dance festival Rasasvada on May 19th and 20th. For hosting these classical dance events, Pratyusha Trust needs financial grant / support. It also need continued aid for its Odissi dance classes for poor and underprivileged children.

Nrityantar, a unit of Pratyusha Public Charitable Trust organised its 8th annual Odissi dance festival, NAMAN 2017 on August 27th. The annual festival brought finest of artistes to Bengaluru audience. It also presented two 2-day classical dance festivals, Kavyarasa and Rasasvada in the month of May and October 2017. For hosting these classical dance events, Pratyusha Trust needs financial grant / support. It also needs continued aid for its Odissi dance classes for poor learners.

Nrityantar, a unit of Pratyusha Public Charitable Trust organised its 8th annual Odissi dance festival, NAMAN 2016 on August 7th. The festival presented leading Odissi dancers. It also presented two 2-day classical dance festivals, Samarasa and Rasasvada in the month of May and October 2016. For hosting these classical dance events, Pratyusha Trust needs financial grant / support. It also needs continued aid for its Odissi dance classes for poor and underprivileged children.

Nrityantar, a unit of Pratyusha Public Charitable Trust organised its 8th annual Odissi dance festival, NAMAN 2015 on August 2nd. The festival showcased best of Odssi dancers. It also presented the Geeta Govinda classical dance festivals, Kavyarasa in the month of May 2015. For hosting these classical dance events, Pratyusha Trust needs financial grant / support. It also needs continued aid for its Odissi dance classes for poor and underprivileged children.
